Articles.Content: Relax. He's on vacation.

Relax. He's on vacation.

NO! You Relax!

Seriously though -- I'm looking forward to what nli2work comes up with for this pack or other KSP stuff. This has been my favorite parts pack by far.

I think I might have figured out why the RetroFuture parts were failing. I had a munged Firespitter plugin install. I had the updated dll file but neglected to include the resources folder from the parts package. Electrical engines require the FSCoolant resource, and if it's not installed the load will hang.

I had a similar problem with another set of parts, and that correcting that oversight fixed it, so I'll check if these are likewise affected.

Edit: Confirmed! I haven't tried to use the parts yet, but it was the missing Firespitter resource that was causing the hang on loading.

Edited December 30, 2014 by ultrasquid

Hello and happy 2015.I have small request,can you make TRReflection patch for all windows(cockpits,scilab,medCrew).Thank you.

Edited January 7, 2015 by sebi.zzr

I think I might have figured out why the RetroFuture parts were failing. I had a munged Firespitter plugin install. I had the updated dll file but neglected to include the resources folder from the parts package. Electrical engines require the FSCoolant resource, and if it's not installed the load will hang.

I had a similar problem with another set of parts, and that correcting that oversight fixed it, so I'll check if these are likewise affected.

Edit: Confirmed! I haven't tried to use the parts yet, but it was the missing Firespitter resource that was causing the hang on loading.

That was the same with the KAX pack. Hooray for easy fixes.

I'm Back still adjusting jet lag and processing photos from the trip. will ease back into KSP as time allows. haven't touched 0.9 yet. I expect RF to work for the most part, as long as plugins are updated.

Firespitter DLL is updated to 0.9 I think, @ snjo.github.io; FSCoolant resource is only necessary if you use electric engines from FS or KAX, make sure the resource is properly defined for KSP in GameData/Firespitter/Resources/

TRReflections MM patch is the lowest hanging fruit and I'll probably do that first.

larger airbreathing engines seems to be a niche that needs to be filled with the new MKIII space plane parts.
Welcome back! Hands down my favorite Kerbal mod, period!

Everything seems to be working well for me in .90 at least. I have two small requests, one: A very basic wheel for fixed landing gear made with struts and stuff, ideally easily stacked for heavier planes and tweakscale-able.

The other idea: A big square ww1-ish engine, something off a S.E.5 or a Bristol F.2. I think it would work well with the square fuselage system you've made so far.

Edit: The pulse jet is glitched, seems odd it would be, maybe a mod conflict...

Speaking of biplane parts, and why they should be in this pack, here's a jet powered biplane!

Keptin came up with a fix for the prop hub freeze bug that can be found in the KAX thread. Will this eventually be implemented in Retrofuture?
I downloaded the mod, but all the fuel tanks have no fuel values/capacity.
^Update firespitter.

>.< I want to use this wih 0.90, but when it tries to load, my game crashes at some point, I haven't figured out why yet, but I uninstalled it for now, though according to CKAN I have the latest firespitter and all too.

>.< I want to use this wih 0.90, but when it tries to load, my game crashes at some point, I haven't figured out why yet, but I uninstalled it for now, though according to CKAN I have the latest firespitter and all too.

If you're using ATM, that's normal.. ATM crashes a lot with this mod while it tries to do the initial texture conversion. It took me 8 crashes/restarts for ATM to convert all textures, but once you passed this initial nuisance, KSP will load fine and RetroFuture will work well

If you're using ATM, that's normal.. ATM crashes a lot with this mod while it tries to do the initial texture conversion. It took me 8 crashes/restarts for ATM to convert all textures, but once you passed this initial nuisance, KSP will load fine and RetroFuture will work well

ATM didn't crash at all with this mod, but it got an odd over shininess of the textures.

I started to get around it, by removing all other mods other then it, and the default ones, as well as ATM, so that way ATM could do the work, without the issues of loading the other mods....But if it crashes once I add the other mods back, then I will know it's a conflict somehow

It worked! .....And I found out the hard way in sandbox the Rectangular fuel tanks...have no fuel in them, they are structural only o_O;;

I can not currently use this mod as others have hinted it crashes both of my KSP machines. However, Cdodders, If you right click on the Fuel tank you can switch between types (atleast you could in .25)
I know this mod hasn't been updated for .90, but the only thing that's broken for me is the pulse jet :/ It has no thrust, it just acts like a fuel tank.

TransparentPods have been tested in v0.9; all appears to be in good working order. minor texture update so the glass panels are slightly more visible; still transparent.
